Description: Terracotta semi-circular disc with two holes. A thick disc with a barely sunken centre and a broad flat rim, the edge of which is slightly raised; the underside is more roughly finished, with a flattish ’base’; before firing the disc was cut in half and two holes were pierced through the rim near the edge of the cut. Hand-made and piereced twice. Possibly a net weight or loom-weight. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant mica and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Parallel from Naukratis, interpreted as a Ptolemaic or earlier loom weight (Bailey 2008, 3700).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TB.40) (Phase 3)
